question: A 17-year-old male presents to the emergency department after a motor vehicle accident. The patient was an unrestrained driver in a head-on collision. He has a past medical history of asthma, depression, and anxiety. He is not currently taking any medications. His temperature is 99.5°F (37.5°C), blood pressure is 90/60 mmHg, pulse is 115/min, respirations are 22/min, and oxygen saturation is 99% on room air. The patient's cardiopulmonary exam is within normal limits. The patient is breathing on his own and has strong distal pulses. Ultimately, the patient is discharged with follow up instructions after no significant fractures or injuries are found. The patient then presents 4 months later to his primary doctor with weakness. The patient's strength in his upper extremities is 1/5. He has reduced sensation in his upper extremities as well. The patient's lower extremities reveal 5/5 strength with intact sensation. A chest radiograph and basic labs are ordered. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
question_persian: مردی ۱۷ ساله پس از یک تصادف رانندگی به بخش اورژانس مراجعه می‌کند. بیمار راننده‌ای بدون کمربند ایمنی در یک تصادف از رو به رو بوده است. او سابقه پزشکی آسم، افسردگی و اضطراب دارد. در حال حاضر هیچ دارویی مصرف نمی‌کند. دمای بدن او ۳۷.۵ درجه سانتیگراد (۹۹.۵ درجه فارنهایت)، فشار خون ۹۰/۶۰ میلی‌متر جیوه، نبض ۱۱۵ ضربه در دقیقه، تنفس ۲۲ بار در دقیقه و اشباع اکسیژن ۹۹٪ در هوای اتاق است. معاینه قلب و ریه بیمار در محدوده طبیعی است. بیمار به طور مستقل نفس می‌کشد و نبض‌های انتهایی قوی دارد. در نهایت، پس از اینکه هیچ شکستگی یا آسیب جدی یافت نشد، بیمار با دستورالعمل‌های پیگیری مرخص می‌شود. بیمار سپس ۴ ماه بعد با علائم ضعف به پزشک اولیه خود مراجعه می‌کند. قدرت عضلانی بیمار در اندام‌های فوقانی ۱ از ۵ است. او همچنین کاهش حس در اندام‌های فوقانی دارد. اندام‌های تحتانی بیمار قدرت ۵ از ۵ با حس سالم دارند. یک رادیوگرافی قفسه سینه و آزمایشات پایه درخواست می‌شود. کدام یک از تشخیص‌های زیر محتمل‌ترین است؟
new_question_stem: A 17-year-old male presents to the emergency department after a motor vehicle accident. The patient was an unrestrained driver in a head-on collision. He has a past medical history of asthma, depression, and anxiety. He is not currently taking any medications. His temperature is 99.5°F (37.5°C), blood pressure is 90/60 mmHg, pulse is 115/min, respirations are 22/min, and oxygen saturation is 99% on room air. The patient's cardiopulmonary exam is within normal limits. The patient is breathing on his own and has strong distal pulses. Ultimately, the patient is discharged with follow up instructions after no significant fractures or injuries are found. The patient then presents 4 months later to his primary doctor with weakness. The patient's strength in his upper extremities is 1/5. He has reduced sensation in his upper extremities as well. The patient's lower extremities reveal 5/5 strength with intact sensation. A chest radiograph and basic labs are ordered. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

question: An 89-year-old woman sees her neurologist for a follow-up evaluation. Three months ago, she presented with complaints about facial asymmetry. Her daughter has noticed that her mother’s mouth is droops downwards on the right side of her face and that she cannot close her right eye well. The same side also lacks wrinkles on the forehead. Since then, the patient feels like her facial muscles have gotten weaker. She was given a course of corticosteroids, but she has still not recovered fully. Upon being asked to close her eyes, the patient has difficulty doing so and fails to completely close her eyelids. On examination, there is no loss of pain, temperature, or crude or tactile touch sensations in the whole face. The neurological exam is otherwise unremarkable. This patient also has type 2 diabetes mellitus which is well controlled with metformin. The neurologist recommends a therapy that will help relieve her symptoms. Which of the following is the most likely treatment option being prescribed to this patient?
question_persian: یک زن ۸۹ ساله برای ارزیابی پیگیری به متخصص مغز و اعصاب خود مراجعه می‌کند. سه ماه پیش، او با شکایاتی از عدم تقارن صورت مراجعه کرد. دخترش متوجه شده است که دهان مادرش در سمت راست صورتش به سمت پایین افتاده و او نمی‌تواند چشم راستش را به خوبی ببندد. همچنین، همان سمت پیشانی فاقد چین و چروک است. از آن زمان، بیمار احساس می‌کند که عضلات صورتش ضعیف‌تر شده‌اند. به او یک دوره کورتیکواستروئید داده شد، اما هنوز به طور کامل بهبود نیافته است. وقتی از او خواسته می‌شود چشمانش را ببندد، بیمار در انجام این کار مشکل دارد و نمی‌تواند پلک‌هایش را به طور کامل ببندد. در معاینه، هیچ فقدان حس درد، دما، یا لمس سطحی در کل صورت وجود ندارد. معاینه عصبی در سایر موارد بی‌نقص است. این بیمار همچنین دیابت نوع ۲ دارد که با متفورمین به خوبی کنترل شده است. متخصص مغز و اعصاب یک درمانی را توصیه می‌کند که به تسکین علائم او کمک خواهد کرد. کدام یک از گزینه‌های زیر به احتمال زیاد به عنوان درمان برای این بیمار تجویز شده است؟
new_question_stem: An 89-year-old woman sees her neurologist for a follow-up evaluation. Three months ago, she presented with complaints about facial asymmetry. Her daughter has noticed that her mother’s mouth is droops downwards on the right side of her face and that she cannot close her right eye well. The same side also lacks wrinkles on the forehead. Since then, the patient feels like her facial muscles have gotten weaker. She was given a course of corticosteroids, but she has still not recovered fully. Upon being asked to close her eyes, the patient has difficulty doing so and fails to completely close her eyelids. On examination, there is no loss of pain, temperature, or crude or tactile touch sensations in the whole face. The neurological exam is otherwise unremarkable. This patient also has type 2 diabetes mellitus which is well controlled with metformin. The neurologist recommends a therapy that will help relieve her symptoms. Which of the following is the most likely treatment option being prescribed to this patient?

question: A 62-year-old man comes to the physician because of worsening involuntary movements of both arms for the past 7 months. He reports that certain daily activities have become more difficult to perform. His father had a similar condition that was treated with medications. The patient appears anxious. Vital signs are within normal limits. Examination shows a low-amplitude tremor bilaterally when the arms are outstretched that worsens when reaching out to grab a pen. Muscle strength and tone is normal bilaterally. Deep tendon reflexes are 2+ bilaterally. On mental status examination, his mood is good. His speech is normal in rate and rhythm. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in management?
question_persian: مردی 62 ساله به دلیل تشدید حرکات غیرارادی هر دو بازو طی 7 ماه گذشته به پزشک مراجعه می‌کند. او گزارش می‌دهد که انجام برخی فعالیت‌های روزانه برایش دشوارتر شده است. پدرش نیز به همین شرایط مبتلا بوده که با داروها درمان می‌شد. بیمار به نظر مضطرب می‌رسد. علائم حیاتی در محدوده نرمال است. معاینه نشان می‌دهد که در هنگام دراز کردن بازوها، لرزش با دامنه کم در هر دو طرف وجود دارد که هنگام تلاش برای گرفتن خودکار بدتر می‌شود. قدرت و تون عضلانی در هر دو طرف نرمال است. رفلکس‌های عمقی تاندونی در هر دو طرف 2+ است. در معاینه وضعیت روانی، خلق و خوی او خوب است. گفتار او از نظر سرعت و ریتم نرمال است. کدام یک از موارد زیر مناسب‌ترین گام بعدی در مدیریت است؟
new_question_stem: A 62-year-old man comes to the physician because of worsening involuntary movements of both arms for the past 7 months. He reports that certain daily activities have become more difficult to perform. His father had a similar condition that was treated with medications. The patient appears anxious. Vital signs are within normal limits. Examination shows a low-amplitude tremor bilaterally when the arms are outstretched that worsens when reaching out to grab a pen. Muscle strength and tone is normal bilaterally. Deep tendon reflexes are 2+ bilaterally. On mental status examination, his mood is good. His speech is normal in rate and rhythm. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in management?

question: A 50-year-old woman with Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) presents to your clinic with complaints of left eye pain and reduced vision. She notes that she was in her usual state of health until 3 days prior to presentation when she noticed some mild tenderness around her left eye, unrelieved by any pain relievers. This morning when she woke up she was unable to see out of her left eye and made an appointment to come see you. Other than SLE, her medical history is unremarkable. She has had no additional symptoms other than pain and vision loss. Her vital signs are all within normal limits. On exam, she has no vision in her left eye, but 20/30 visual acuity in her right eye. When you shine a light in her left eye there is no response. What response would you expect when you shine a light in her right eye?
question_persian: یک زن ۵۰ ساله با لوپوس اریتماتوز سیستمیک (SLE) به کلینیک شما مراجعه کرده و از درد چشم چپ و کاهش بینایی شکایت دارد. او بیان می‌کند که تا ۳ روز قبل از مراجعه در وضعیت سلامت معمول خود بوده است که متوجه شد مقداری حساسیت خفیف در اطراف چشم چپش دارد که با هیچ مسکن تسکین نمی‌یافت. این صبح که از خواب بیدار شد، نتوانست از چشم چپ خود ببیند و تصمیم گرفت برای ویزیت به شما مراجعه کند. به غیر از SLE، سابقه پزشکی او بدون مورد خاصی است. او هیچ علائم دیگری به جز درد و از دست دادن بینایی نداشته است. علائم حیاتی او همگی در محدوده نرمال هستند. در معاینه، او در چشم چپ خود بینایی ندارد، اما در چشم راستش وضوح دید ۳۰/۲۰ دارد. وقتی نور را به چشم چپش می‌تابانید هیچ پاسخی وجود ندارد. چه پاسخی را انتظار دارید وقتی نور را به چشم راستش می‌تابانید؟

options.C: Miosis of the right eye only
options.D: Miosis of the left eye only

options_persian.D: تنگی مردمک فقط در چشم چپ

new_question_stem: A 50-year-old woman with Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) presents to your clinic with complaints of left eye pain and reduced vision. She notes that she was in her usual state of health until 3 days prior to presentation when she noticed some mild tenderness around her left eye, unrelieved by any pain relievers. This morning when she woke up she was unable to see out of her left eye and made an appointment to come see you. Other than SLE, her medical history is unremarkable. She has had no additional symptoms other than pain and vision loss. Her vital signs are all within normal limits. On exam, she has no vision in her left eye, but 20/30 visual acuity in her right eye. When you shine a light in her left eye there is no response. What response would you expect when you shine a light in her right eye?

question: A 24-year-old woman comes to the emergency department with her boyfriend 2 hours after an episode of loss of consciousness. She was seated and was being tattooed on her right upper flank when she became diaphoretic, pale, and passed out. According to her boyfriend, the patient slipped to the floor and her arms and legs moved in a jerky fashion for a few seconds. She regained consciousness within half a minute and was alert and fully oriented immediately. She has no history of serious illness. She works as an event manager and has had more stress than usual due to a recent concert tour. She appears well. Her temperature is 37°C (98.4°F), pulse is 68/min, respirations are 16/min, and blood pressure is 120/72 mm Hg. Her cardiopulmonary examination shows no abnormalities. Neurologic examination shows no focal findings. An ECG shows an incomplete right bundle branch block. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
question_persian: زنی ۲۴ ساله به همراه دوست‌پسرش ۲ ساعت پس از یک اپیزود از دست دادن هوشیاری به بخش اورژانس مراجعه می‌کند. او نشسته بود و در حال خالکوبی روی پهلوی بالای سمت راست خود بود که دچار تعریق شدید، رنگ‌پریدگی و بیهوشی شد. به گفته دوست‌پسرش، بیمار به زمین افتاد و دست‌ها و پاهایش برای چند ثانیه به صورت تکان‌های ناگهانی حرکت کردند. او در کمتر از نیم دقیقه به هوش آمد و بلافاصله هوشیار و کاملاً آگاه بود. او سابقه بیماری جدی ندارد. او به عنوان مدیر رویداد کار می‌کند و به دلیل یک تور کنسرت اخیر بیشتر از حد معمول دچار استرس شده است. او به نظر خوب می‌رسد. دمای بدنش ۳۷ درجه سانتی‌گراد (۹۸.۴ درجه فارنهایت)، نبض ۶۸ در دقیقه، تنفس ۱۶ در دقیقه و فشار خون ۱۲۰/۷۲ میلی‌متر جیوه است. معاینه قلبی-ریوی او هیچ گونه ناهنجاری نشان نمی‌دهد. معاینه عصبی نیز هیچ یافته کانونی نشان نمی‌دهد. الکتروکاردیوگرام (ECG) یک بلوک شاخه‌ای راست ناقص را نشان می‌دهد. کدام یک از موارد زیر محتمل‌ترین تشخیص است؟
new_question_stem: A 24-year-old woman comes to the emergency department with her boyfriend 2 hours after an episode of loss of consciousness. She was seated and was being tattooed on her right upper flank when she became diaphoretic, pale, and passed out. According to her boyfriend, the patient slipped to the floor and her arms and legs moved in a jerky fashion for a few seconds. She regained consciousness within half a minute and was alert and fully oriented immediately. She has no history of serious illness. She works as an event manager and has had more stress than usual due to a recent concert tour. She appears well. Her temperature is 37°C (98.4°F), pulse is 68/min, respirations are 16/min, and blood pressure is 120/72 mm Hg. Her cardiopulmonary examination shows no abnormalities. Neurologic examination shows no focal findings. An ECG shows an incomplete right bundle branch block. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

question: A 62-year-old man is brought to the physician by his wife because of difficulties walking for the past year. He has had multiple falls over the past 4 months. Over the past 6 months, he has had progressive urinary urgency and now wears an adult diaper as is not always able to control the urge to void. His appetite has also decreased in this time period. He used to drive, but his wife convinced him to stop after she noticed that he was becoming increasingly inattentive while driving. He has type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension. Current medications include ramipril and metformin. His temperature is 37.1C (98.8F), pulse is 90/min and blood pressure is 132/88 mm Hg. Examination shows a broad-based gait with slow and short steps. Neurologic examination shows no focal findings. On mental status examination, he is oriented to person and place but not to time. Attention and concentration are impaired. He recalls only one of three objects after 5 minutes. Which of the following is the most appropriate therapy for this patient's symptoms?
question_persian: مردی ۶۲ ساله به دلیل مشکلاتی در راه رفتن که در یک سال گذشته داشته است توسط همسرش به پزشک آورده می‌شود. او در ۴ ماه گذشته چندین بار افتاده است. در ۶ ماه گذشته، او به تدریج دچار اضطرار ادراری شده و اکنون از پوشک بزرگسال استفاده می‌کند زیرا همیشه قادر به کنترل ادرار نیست. اشتهای او نیز در این مدت کاهش یافته است. او قبلاً رانندگی می‌کرد، اما همسرش او را متقاعد کرد که رانندگی را متوقف کند زیرا متوجه شده بود که او هنگام رانندگی بیشتر بی‌توجه می‌شود. او مبتلا به دیابت نوع ۲ و فشار خون بالا است. داروهای فعلی شامل رامیپریل و متفورمین است. دمای بدن او ۳۷.۱ درجه سانتی‌گراد (۹۸.۸ درجه فارنهایت)، نبض ۹۰ ضربه در دقیقه و فشار خون ۱۳۲/۸۸ میلی‌متر جیوه است. معاینه نشان می‌دهد که او راه رفتن با پایه گسترده و گام‌های کند و کوتاه دارد. معاینه عصبی نشان دهنده هیچ یافته کانونی نیست. در معاینه وضعیت روانی، او به شخص و مکان آگاه است اما به زمان نه. توجه و تمرکز او مختل شده است. او تنها یک شیء از سه شیء را پس از ۵ دقیقه به خاطر می‌آورد. کدام یک از موارد زیر مناسب‌ترین درمان برای علائم این بیمار است؟
new_question_stem: A 62-year-old man is brought to the physician by his wife because of difficulties walking for the past year. He has had multiple falls over the past 4 months. Over the past 6 months, he has had progressive urinary urgency and now wears an adult diaper as is not always able to control the urge to void. His appetite has also decreased in this time period. He used to drive, but his wife convinced him to stop after she noticed that he was becoming increasingly inattentive while driving. He has type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension. Current medications include ramipril and metformin. His temperature is 37.1C (98.8F), pulse is 90/min and blood pressure is 132/88 mm Hg. Examination shows a broad-based gait with slow and short steps. Neurologic examination shows no focal findings. On mental status examination, he is oriented to person and place but not to time. Attention and concentration are impaired. He recalls only one of three objects after 5 minutes. Which of the following is the most appropriate therapy for this patient's symptoms?

question: A 40-year-old woman with Down syndrome comes to the physician for the evaluation of fatigue, progressive clumsiness when using her hands, and difficulty walking for 3 months. During this period, the patient has had several episodes of dizziness as well as double vision. She also reports that she has lost control of her bladder on several occasions lately. She has not had any trauma or weight changes. She lives with her sister and works as a cashier in a local retail store. She takes no medications. Her vital signs are within normal limits. On mental status examination, she is oriented to person and place only. There is moderate weakness of the upper and lower extremities. Sensory examination shows no abnormalities. Deep tendon reflexes are 3+ bilaterally. Babinski's sign is present bilaterally. Which of the following would most likely improve this patient's symptoms?
question_persian: یک زن ۴۰ ساله با سندرم داون به پزشک مراجعه می‌کند برای ارزیابی خستگی، عدم مهارت تدریجی در استفاده از دست‌ها و مشکل در راه رفتن به مدت ۳ ماه. در این مدت، بیمار چندین بار دچار سرگیجه و دید دوگانه شده است. او همچنین گزارش می‌دهد که اخیراً چندین بار کنترل مثانه خود را از دست داده است. او هیچ تروما یا تغییر وزنی نداشته است. او با خواهرش زندگی می‌کند و به عنوان صندوقدار در یک فروشگاه محلی کار می‌کند. او هیچ دارویی مصرف نمی‌کند. علائم حیاتی او در محدوده طبیعی هستند. در معاینه وضعیت روانی، او فقط به شخص و مکان آگاه است. ضعف متوسطی در اندام‌های فوقانی و تحتانی وجود دارد. معاینه حسی هیچ ناهنجاری‌ای نشان نمی‌دهد. رفلکس‌های تاندونی عمقی به صورت 3+ دو طرفه هستند. علامت بابینسکی به صورت دوطرفه وجود دارد. کدام یک از موارد زیر به احتمال زیاد علائم این بیمار را بهبود می‌بخشد؟

options_persian.B: جوش دادن جراحی مهره‌های گردنی C1/C2

new_question_stem: A 40-year-old woman with Down syndrome comes to the physician for the evaluation of fatigue, progressive clumsiness when using her hands, and difficulty walking for 3 months. During this period, the patient has had several episodes of dizziness as well as double vision. She also reports that she has lost control of her bladder on several occasions lately. She has not had any trauma or weight changes. She lives with her sister and works as a cashier in a local retail store. She takes no medications. Her vital signs are within normal limits. On mental status examination, she is oriented to person and place only. There is moderate weakness of the upper and lower extremities. Sensory examination shows no abnormalities. Deep tendon reflexes are 3+ bilaterally. Babinski's sign is present bilaterally. Which of the following would most likely improve this patient's symptoms?
